libshapedraw.event

Class LSDRespawnEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • libshapedraw.event.LSDEvent
      • libshapedraw.event.LSDRespawnEvent

  • public class LSDRespawnEvent
extends LSDEvent
    Event fired when the player respawns into a new world instance. This does not necessarily mean the world changed; the player could be respawning after death or teleportation.

    Provided as a convenience; re-initializing the canvas of shapes after the player enters a new server is a common use case.

    Caveat: do not rely on playerCoords to be accurate. Minecraft will often reposition the player shortly after respawning.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • isNewServer

        public boolean isNewServer()
        Whether the player is spawning for the first time during a server connection session. This includes single player worlds, which use an integrated server.

        Reconnecting to the same dedicated server will result in another event with isNewServer==true.

        Implies isNewDimension.

      • isNewDimension

        public boolean isNewDimension()
        Whether the player respawned in a different dimension (e.g., taking a Nether/End portal, or dying in one of those dimensions then respawning back in the overworld.)

        If true, the world definitely changed. If false, it's not safe to assume either way. The server might be running a multi-world plugin.

        Always true if isNewServer.
